title: Missing include file endlessly spams log

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

body:
I misconfigured an `.stignore` file to include a file that did not exist:

```
$ cat /syncthing/notes/.stignore
// .stignore
#include .stglobalignore
```

This leads to syncthing logging an error at a very high rate (at least dozens of times per second):

```
$ tail -n20 /syncthing/syncthing.log
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 WARNING: Error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a): loading ignores: parse error: failed to load include file .stglobalignore: open /syncthing/notes/.stglobalignore: no such file or directory
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now error
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 INFO: Cleared error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a)
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now idle
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now sync-waiting
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 WARNING: Error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a): loading ignores: parse error: failed to load include file .stglobalignore: open /syncthing/notes/.stglobalignore: no such file or directory
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now error
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 INFO: Cleared error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a)
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now idle
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now sync-waiting
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 WARNING: Error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a): loading ignores: parse error: failed to load include file .stglobalignore: open /syncthing/notes/.stglobalignore: no such file or directory
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now error
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 INFO: Cleared error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a)
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now idle
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now sync-waiting
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 WARNING: Error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a): loading ignores: parse error: failed to load include file .stglobalignore: open /syncthing/notes/.stglobalignore: no such file or directory
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now error
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 INFO: Cleared error on folder "notes" (pyt9c-kd72a)
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now idle
[FHHUZ] 21:57:28 VERBOSE: Folder "pyt9c-kd72a" is now sync-waiting
```

I rotate my log files monthly; this error caused last month's log to grow to 20 GB on disk (would have been much larger without ZFS compression). I also found that RAM usage increased significantly with the file missing (normal: 300 MB, with missing file: 10 GB).

Expected behaviour would be that syncthing uses a longer retry interval before attempting to reload the missing included file.

System information: FreeBSD 13.0-RELEASE-p7, syncthing 1.18.1.
